TopicTitle: [1.4.0-1.8.1] NavUtilities continued, ft. HSI & Instrument Landing System [v0.7.2] (2018 Apr, 1)

Articles.Content:
1 hour ago, Ser said:

Couldn't reproduce that.

OK, I've changed the configs.
Any hope of adding this to CKAN?

6 hours ago, Steel929 said:

Any hope of adding this to CKAN?

 

It should be on CKAN according to Spacedock.

17 hours ago, Steel929 said:

Any hope of adding this to CKAN?

 

11 hours ago, Ser said:

It should be on CKAN according to Spacedock.

It's on CKAN, but doesn't show 1.3 compatibility -- so it won't appear unless you "back-date" your allowed versions and manually allow it.
I can't get the right click menu to open... strange.

1 hour ago, Bob Jub said:

I can't get the right click menu to open... strange.

Try Alt-click

Is there a cfg edit that makes the ILS window ignore INS waypoints and only show runways?

Edited August 30, 2017 by the_machemer

3 hours ago, the_machemer said:

Is there a cfg edit that makes the ILS window ignore INS waypoints and only show runways?

Just out of curiosity, could you post a screen shot of the problem? (I can't remember experiencing such a problem).

18 hours ago, Rodhern said:

Just out of curiosity, could you post a screen shot of the problem? (I can't remember experiencing such a problem).

Considering that Ser's first post after OP mentions that he fixed INS waypoint name display, I'm guessing that this is a feature not a bug. I've scoured all the NavUtilities files and haven't found anything that toggles this feature so I'm just wondering if I've missed something. 

I would attach an image but I don't know how and I'm out of the country using my phone as a hotspot so I don't wanna use up my very limited data. In fact I probably shouldn't be using it for troubleshooting mod niggles as is

On 30/08/2017 at 4:29 PM, the_machemer said:

Is there a cfg edit that makes the ILS window ignore INS waypoints and only show runways?

There's no such setting. The INS waypoint is always shown in the HSI when waypoint navigation is activated. But what's the problem? If you need directions to a runway just deactivate navigation via map view or Waypoint Manager mod.

6 hours ago, Ser said:

There's no such setting. The INS waypoint is always shown in the HSI when waypoint navigation is activated. But what's the problem? If you need directions to a runway just deactivate navigation via map view or Waypoint Manager mod.

Oh its not really a big problem, just wondering how far I can personalize it to suit my specific needs. Thanks for the reply.

This is just so great. Where do I paste this configs?

1 hour ago, Daniel Prates said:

This is just so great. Where do I paste this configs?

Create *.cfg file (i.e. KerbinCity.cfg) in GameData\NavUtilities Continued\Runways.

Edited October 16, 2017 by Shnyrik

1 hour ago, Shnyrik said:

Create *.cfg file (i.e. KerbinCity.cfg) in GameData\NavUtilities Continued\Runways.

Do I have to create one for every single runway that I wish to be an option for the VOR?

11 hours ago, Daniel Prates said:

Do I have to create one for every single runway

Of course, not Just a single file for all. Or you can add those configs to the existing customrunways.cfg.

30 minutes ago, Shnyrik said:

Of course, not Just a single file for all. Or you can add those configs to the existing customrunways.cfg.

Ok thanks! I'll sure try!
Could you update the metadata for 1.3.1 please? CKAN is being persnickety again

Hi !

Does this work for 1.3.1 ? When will it get updated on CKAN?

Cheers,

Would it be possible to get a mirror?
Spacedock is down.

On 11/11/2017 at 2:58 PM, Lodvib said:

Would it be possible to get a mirror?
Spacedock is down.

In such cases you can always find the latest release on github

is this mod works in KSP 1.3.1?

where should i place this mod?

inside JSI ?

On 12/12/2017 at 4:35 PM, DiscoveryPlanet said:

is this mod works in KSP 1.3.1?

where should i place this mod?

inside JSI ?

It should work with KSP 1.3.1 just fine. Put the contents of the downloaded zip into GameData folder.

On 7/16/2017 at 4:01 AM, Ser said:

In IRL those speeds are provided in the landing chart like here

JEBBESEN !  Oh My Zeus, that is funny.  And, thanks so much for taking this mod on.  Now if I could find a USB Joystick that did not suck, maybe I could land a plane on Kerbin without the usual BOOM.

6 hours ago, GenjoKoan said:

JEBBESEN !  Oh My Zeus, that is funny.  And, thanks so much for taking this mod on.  Now if I could find a USB Joystick that did not suck, maybe I could land a plane on Kerbin without the usual BOOM.

I usually do my flying with Saitek X52 Pro with its pros and cons, but in KSP I use this mod: Analog Control Continued

11 hours ago, Ser said:

 but in KSP I use this mod: Analog Control Continued

I had seen this mod in name only, but never looked.  Your video really sells it so I will give it a try.  I have a large shelf full of pretty good flight sim hardware, all pre-usb.  It would cost a small fortune to replace them.  Thank you so much Microsoft, for abandoning game port, NOT.  My favorite old one is the Saitek Cyborg 3D.  It would be great for space flight / RCS.
